alert.note: Alert for Breathitt; Clay; Jackson; Laurel; Lee; Owsley; Rockcastle (Kentucky) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued January 01 at 6:26AM EST by NWS Jackson
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of north central Laurel, Owsley, southern Jackson, southeastern Rockcastle, western Breathitt, southeastern Lee and north central Clay Counties through 715 AM EST... At 626 AM EST, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Privett, or near McKee, moving east at 50 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This strong thunderstorm will be near... Green Hall, Elian, Nathanton, Sourwood and Sextons Creek around 630 AM EST. Sturgeon, Endee, Travellers Rest, Vincent, Blake, Island City, Wild Dog, Delvinta and Earnestville around 635 AM EST. Booneville, Scoville, Turin, Major, Southfork, Levi, Conkling, Pebworth, Taff and Ida May around 640 AM EST. Eversole, Cowcreek, Chestnut Gap, Lerose, Stay, Ricetown, Grass, Gobbard, Lower Buffalo and Sebastian around 645 AM EST. Other locations in the path of this storm include Jetts Creek, Houston, Arnett, Lone, Athol, Tallega, Morris Fork, Canyon Falls, Dalesburg, Turkey, Guerrant, Canoe, Sebastian`s Branch, Copebranch, Chenowee, Talbert, Oakdale, Crockettsville, War Creek, Curt, Howard Creek, Copland, Saldee, Elkatawa, Yeadon, Gentry, Little, Whick, Frozen Creek, Jackson, Dumont, Haddix and Inverness. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Heavy rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 800 AM EST for south central and southeastern Kentucky.

area.areaDesc: Breathitt; Clay; Jackson; Laurel; Lee; Owsley; Rockcastle
